titleStmt.title: David Needy et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5172

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We the undersigned policemen of the city of Louisville, would respectfully -- state to Your Excellency -- that, Napoleon Roberts convicted in the Jefferson Circuit Court and George & Scott Roberts indicted in same court for killing one Bell a Colourd Soldier in May last -- are industrious -- orderly and well behaved coloured people -- We would further -- represent to your Excellency that the difficulty in which Bell lost his life grew out of a previous difficulty between the police of the city, and a party of Coloured soldiers, in which the Robert's or one of them assisted the police in attempting to arrest the soldiers -- who were violent & disorderly men --

David Needy
Liuetenet of 5 Polis Dist
mat Fleming Polies man
John Trayler "
Fred Black "
Patrick. OConnor "
Louis Bache No 24 city Polic
A J Sayer No 92 city Polic
Wm McKinney "

all the above names ar Poliesman of the city of Louisville Ky
